channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: A StubHub co-founder says he was scrubbed from the company’s history in its IPO filing: ‘It appears old wounds are deep enough to lie about the company’s founding story’
item.description: Jeff Fluhr dropped out of business school to become StubHub’s CEO, now he’s not receiving credit for his efforts as the company tries to go public.

item.title: Diane Sykes: A Model Judge
item.description: The chief judge of the Seventh Circuit is an example for others to follow — including in her decision to retire.

item.title: The Supreme Court Killed March Madness
item.description: The Cinderellas simply can’t compete anymore.

item.title: Trump nominates Georgia state Sen Brandon Beach for US treasurer
item.description: President Donald Trump on Wednesday nominated Georgia state Sen. Brandon Beach for U.S. treasurer. He has served as a state senator in Georgia since 2...

item.title: Maybe It Wasn’t Such a Great Idea to Support a Larger, More Extensive Federal Government for 100 Years
item.description: The Left gets hoisted on its own petard.

item.title: Zonda’s chief economist never thought Trump, the only real estate mogul-turned-president, would place tariffs on building materials when housing is already so unaffordable. She was wrong
item.description: Ali Wolf went from feeling somewhat optimistic about the housing market to concerned in a matter of months. Blame the policy whirlwind.

item.title: The Trump Administration Shouldn’t Disarm Itself Against Iran
item.description: Closing the Middle East Broadcast Network is not making America great again in a region critical to President Trump’s foreign policy agenda.

item.title: Democrat Upset In Pennsylvania Special Election Is Not About Backlash To Trump

item.title: A Visit to the National Gallery, a High Point in the Swamp
item.description: It’s back to the ’70s in a first-rate photo show; plus, an overstuffed, overwrought Elizabeth Catlett show. But the place, as always, looks great.

item.title: Texas DOGE bill passes Senate to streamline state regulations

item.title: Homeland Security Secretary Noem tours El Salvador prison where deported Venezuelans are held
item.description: Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem on Wednesday visited the high-security El Salvador prison where Venezuelans who the Trump administration alleg...

item.title: 10 Times NPR Proved It Doesn’t Deserve Another Taxpayer Cent
item.description: On top of its blackout of the Hunter Biden laptop story, here are 10 other times NPR proved it doesn't deserve another taxpayer dime.

item.title: DOGE slashes billions more in expenses for programs like Peruvian climate change and gender equity in Mexico
item.description: DOGE announced it slashed 113 contracts valued at $4.7 billion for $3.3 billion in savings for programs like climate change in Peru and gender equity ...

item.title: NPR’s Leftist CEO’s Testimony Is Laughable, But The Joke’s On The Taxpayer
item.description: Katherine Maher told a congressional committee on Wednesday that NPR delivers 'nonpartisan, fact-based' reporting. Hilarious.

item.title: Brazilian President Lula swipes at new 25% auto tariffs, saying Trump is president only of the U.S. not the world
item.description: “I am very concerned about the behavior of the American government,” Lula said.

item.title: Amy Coney Barrett Could Be A Superb Supreme Court Justice. She’s Choosing Not To Be
item.description: What Barrett fails to realize is that her failure to consistently abide by originalist doctrine is placing Americans' constitutional rights at risk.

item.title: Glean CEO Arvind Jain: Lessons from an AI unicorn
item.description: For Glean CEO Arvind Jain, transitioning the company from a scrappy startup to an AI unicorn with nearly 800 employees has been a challenge.

item.title: Delta’s secret trading card program has a new design for its 100th anniversary—but you’ll need to ask your pilot to get one
item.description: The trading cards feature a photo and a fun fact about the planes in Delta’s fleet.

item.title: Meet The Democrat Donor Judge Hamstringing Trump’s Military ‘Trans’ Policy
item.description: O'Hearn's judicial activism hardly makes her an anomaly among rogue judges on board with greenlighting leftists' lawfare against Trump.

item.title: Net Worth Optimization: A New Era of Personalized Risk Optimization

item.title: Year of Shifting Sands: Reflections on the 2024 Global IPO Market
item.description: The dynamics of global capital flows are shifting. While the overall IPO market contracted last year, a closer look paints a more nuanced picture.

item.title: Book Review: Buffett’s Early Investments
item.description: This book digs into Buffett’s pre-Berkshire investments. The result is a fresh look into the origins of his investment approach.

item.title: The Alternative View: 401(k) Plans Are Better off Without Private Investments
item.description: The debate over the inclusion of private investments in 401(k) plans is a hot topic. Are DC plans better off without them?
